Description: Fragment of oval handle of a Chian pottery transport amphora to moderate turn. Clay fine pink-buff. Rectangular stamp.
Curator's comments: The trimming of the piece suggest it is from Naukratis and may be Petrie Diary (EES Archive XVII 47) p. 122, 22, rather than IG XII 2 633 as suggested in the Register. Name Hegesias (or -os).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.0054)
